Q:
Our company has 9 computers connected by several communication links. These computers are named: Server Starfire, Server Nightshade, Server Oceanview, Server Darkhorse, Server Glacierpeak, Server Ironclad, Server Nightfall, Server Lighthouse and Server Emberfall. 
To ensure network security, we need to install monitoring devices (such as firewalls or intrusion detection systems) on some of these computers so that all communication links are monitored. 
Assume that the connections between the computers (i.e., the communication links) are bidirectional. This means that information can flow in both directions across any link. Our goal is to deploy monitoring devices in a way that ensures all communication links are covered by at least one monitoring device. 
Problem: How can we select the minimum number of computers to deploy monitoring devices, such that every communication link is monitored by at least one device? 
Communication links as follows: : 
Server Starfire is connected with Server Oceanview, Server Darkhorse, Server Ironclad, Server Emberfall. 
Server Nightshade is connected with Server Oceanview, Server Emberfall. 
Server Oceanview is connected with Server Darkhorse, Server Ironclad, Server Nightfall. 
Server Darkhorse is connected with Server Nightfall, Server Lighthouse. 
Server Glacierpeak is connected with Server Nightfall, Server Emberfall. 
Server Ironclad is connected with Server Nightfall, Server Emberfall. 
Server Lighthouse is connected with Server Emberfall.
